meta.title: How to Make a Teddy Bear

details.text: the arm pieces together, leaving a slit for stuffing (usually at the elbows).
the leg pieces together (usually along the bottom).

step.em: Stitch the two head profiles together from the nose to the neck.

details.text: the wedge shaped piece (this is known as a "gusset") between the two head pieces - from the nose or forehead to the back of the neck (this depends on the length of the gussett). You will need to line it up at the neck and pin it in place before sewing.

step.em: Stuff the head and sew it to the top of the body, around the neck line.
Assemble the bear by attaching the arms to the sides of the body and attaching the legs to the lower sides of the body.
Cut, sew, turn and attach ears (if you want them, as not all bear patterns have them).
Add facial details (like nose and mouth, etc.
Take good care of your teddy bear, or it may easily fall apart!

ul.li: Make your stitching tight so that your friend will last you a long time.
Make sure when you are sewing you do the stitches quite close together.
You can make teddy bear clothes as well.
Embroidered eyes are better for smaller kids who tend to put every thing in their mouth.
If you make clothes, get some cute material (if it's a kid girls teddy)you could get some pink material or something, and make it pajamas, sporting jerseys, jeans,tops,knit a jumper etc.
Children should be closely supervised if they are attempting to make this.
Scissors and needles are sharp so be careful how you handle and use them.
Fake Fur or other sturdy fabric
